name:
You may wonder if I tried to leave. I did, a lot of times. It's just that all exits are blocked.

The books I read speak of a vast and complicated universe, but my world is rather small.

My world is four rooms, the engine room, the control room, the living room and the bedroom.

I occasionally go through these rooms, hoping to find something I've missed.

The Bedroom is, like all other rooms, tiny and cramped.
The bed is comfortable though.
It has a single bed, with a name next to it: John. I suppose it's my name. I wonder who put it there.

This is the room I first woke up in. I still remember the headache.

The Living Room is small, but functional. It contains a small kitchen, a table a computer, and a few books.

The kitchen and the table aren't interesting, but I spent quite some time with the computer and the books.

They at least give me a glimpse of other people; reading books is the closest I can get here to interacting with another person.

The control room is where I read the sonars and set the bearing of the ship. It contains a lot of other controls, but these controls no longer seem to serve any function.

I wonder why such a simple ship has such complicated controls.

The Engine Room is large and noisy. It seems it has seen better days. It always baffled me that it has always been in a bad state.

I've tried many times, but I'm unable to turn the engine off. This means I'll keep steering to prevent the vessel from crashing into things.

You see a darkness with a green tint. Sometimes you see large shapes of different shades of green. It doesn't seem that interesting, but, hey, it's variation.

I read about hugely varried world with interesting plants, and animals, but none of that seems to be here, this is just the same repeating nothingness.

After all this time, I'm still not sure how big this world actually is; it may as well be infinite. It would be ironic though, to have an infinite world of repeating nothingness.

The computer seems to be mostly here for entertainment. It's mostly broken, but still has some television shows on there. For some inexplicable reason it also has quite a few programs on there to track the position of stars. This makes very little sense, as no stars are visible from the vessel.
I've watched all of them by now.

I've read all of the books by now, or at least, they all feel familiar.

From reading the books I gathered that my situation isn't normal; normally people aren't alone in a tiny vessel.

It still bewilders me that I don't remember my own past. From the books, I gathered it's normal to have parents, but I just remember waking up and being here, with nothing before that.

I sometimes think some other being has just created me as a weird joke of sorts, but then I remember it doesn't matter why I'm here, because I can't get out of here anyway.
Still, these thoughts are a way to interrupt the boring flow of life here.
